awd_titl_txt: Mechanism of Mixed Mode I/III Fracture of Alloys
awd_abstract_narration: This proposal explores mixed-mode fracture in two aluminum alloys               and a titanium aluminide alloy.  Variations in microstructure allow             for analysis of the role of second phase precipitates and                       dispersoids on the fracture process.  Variables include particle                shape and volume fraction, temperature, and matrix condition.                   Mechanical behavior to be examined includes fracture toughness,                 plane strain tension and compression behavior, and axisymmmetric                tensile flow.  Scanning and transmission electron microscopy are                used to characterize the microstructure.  Both theoretical and                  experimental approaches are outlined, the theory examining shear                bands in such materials.  The shear bands are represented by a tilt             wall dislocation array, a portion of which can breakaway and                    propagate, interacting with dispersed particles in the vicinity.                %%%                                                                             The fracture of structural metal alloys is important to a wide                  variety of applications.  This research advances our understanding              of crack propagation in complex alloys and should provide avenues               of applied research that will lead to improvement of mechanical                 properties of structural materials.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
